cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles south of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move northwest across the northwest Caribbean, cross western Cuba Tuesday, then track north-northwest across the central Gulf toward the north-central Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (likely southeast or south-central LA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Pinar del Río & Artemisa (Cuba) and Isle of Youth; Tropical Storm Watch for La Habana (Cuba)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Cayman Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Cuba, southeastern Gulf of Mexico, and northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to Mississippi/Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Small (10–12%) chance of sustained 34-kt winds late Thu–Fri; otherwise mainly breezy with gusts below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Port Freeport under the current forecast track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring brief squalls, but heavy rainfall totals over 4 inches are unlikely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells and elevated seas in the Gulf late week could hamper vessel operations and offshore transfers.
